featured.text: Today David wears casual clothes—khaki pants and a sports shirt—to the office.
He marketed his brand by giving clothes to famous MTV stars and featuring teen stars in his print ads.
We human beings may live without clothes, but food and air are ______ to our life.
Women often wear dots that match the color of their clothes.

other.text: Soon after that, adolescent girls around the world began wearing their underwear outside their clothes.
Another reason is that people seem happier and more productive when they are wearing comfortable clothes.
David Smith refers to himself as having been “a clothes addict,” because _________.
Why have so many companies started allowing their employees to wear casual clothes?
Many workers want to wear casual clothes to impress people.
Since then, other companies have jumped on the bandwagon to promote everything from soft drinks to new clothes as a 27 .
so I could change if my clothes got wrinkled.”
David Smith wears casual clothes now, because _________.
“I was a clothes addict,” he jokes.
“For the same amount of money, you can buy a lot more casual clothes.” 51.
In the early 1990s, many companies allowed their employees to wear casual clothes on Friday (but only on Friday).
More and more companies are allowing their office workers to wear casual clothes to work.

definition.zh_def: 給予穿著的衣物或覆蓋物。
definition.en_def: To provide someone with clothes or to dress someone.
definition.example: She decided to clothe the children in warm jackets for the winter.
